name: Corporal William Farber

topics.response_text: Listen, asshole. I know you're not really an NCR health inspector, so you can cut the restaurant critic routine.
{Sarcastic}Oh yeah. You can order up anything you want... as long as it's corn or beans!<Laughs>

topics.topic_text: I'd like to buy some food.
Can anything be done to improve your supplies?
topics.response_text: {Tired sigh, lamenting lack of supplies}Well, we haven't had any quality meat in months. Everyone in the camp just eating beans for protein... It isn't pretty.

topics.topic_text: Could you remind me where I should look for supplies?
topics.response_text: What do you need to know?

topics.topic_text: Is there a health inspector bothering you?
topics.response_text: Ah, it's nothing. You just looked like the health inspector who stopped through for the yearly inspection a couple weeks back.

topics.topic_text: Where would you suggest I find meat in the amount you'd need here?
topics.response_text: {Reassuring}It doesn't need to all come from the same source. There are a bunch of different vendors around who sell meat. Fitz, the Nash's, Crimson Caravan...

topics.topic_text: What parts are needed to fix the food processor?
topics.response_text: {To the point}Here is the list. We've been scrapping together quick-fixes to keep it running for months. I think it finally crapped out and needs a full overhaul.

topics.topic_text: Where might I find these parts?
topics.response_text: {At a loss}I don't know. Try the various traders around the wastes, or the pawn shop in Westside might have some parts.

topics.topic_text: Where should I look for spices?
topics.response_text: The Crimson Caravan would probably be able to arrange a regular shipment, but I don't know of any spices known to improve mood.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to talk about something else.
topics.response_text: What can I do for you?

topics.topic_text: Mrs. Nash agreed to trade with McCarran.
topics.response_text: {Pleased}Great! Small price to pay in caps for a little variety in our weekly menu.

topics.topic_text: Blake at the Crimson Caravan agreed to sell meat and spices.
topics.response_text: {Pleased}Good to hear. That should cover the majority of the supply.

topics.topic_text: I found a merchant named Fitz who agreed to sell meat to McCarran.
topics.response_text: {Pleased}Good, that should help diversify things. It may be a bit gamey, but I can use it for stews and kabobs.
Amazing. I thought that thing was done for. That'll help me transform what I can offer the troops.

topics.topic_text: This spore pod extract from Keely should help with morale.
topics.response_text: {Pleasantly surprised}No shit? The stuff actually does all that, huh?

description:
Corporal William Farber is a 38 year-old African American Male.

A middle-aged African American man serving as the mess officer at Camp McCarran. He takes pride in his culinary skills but struggles to maintain quality with limited resources, particularly the scarcity of fresh meat.

Corporal William Farber's Personality: Practical and resourceful, with a no-nonsense attitude. He values efficiency and quality in his work but is resigned to the limitations of the wasteland. Can be grumpy when dealing with complaints about food quality but has a soft spot for those who appreciate his cooking.

Corporal William Farber's Backstory: William Farber grew up in the NCR-controlled territory, learning to cook from his mother who ran a small diner in Shady Sands. He joined the NCR Army as a young man and worked his way up to corporal, eventually taking on the role of mess officer at Camp McCarran due to his culinary skills. He's served at the camp for five years and has become a familiar face to the troopers, though his recent struggles with food quality have made him less popular.
